text: the Kremlin aren't impressed with this a
giant suitcase the size of a block of
flats planted in the middle of Moscow's
Red Square
the French luxury brand Louie Vuitton
put it there as part of a publicity
stunt but it caused outrage amongst some
Russians lawmakers are furious and
tourists claim it's blocking the view of
monuments such as some basil cathedral
and Lenin's Mausoleum digitallearn first
appear in the Red Square it looks ugly
all the criticisms are justified the
case takes up too much space you can't
see anything else oh I see something
lovely now you don't know if the fact is
they like to ban everything in Russia
but this trunk reflects everything we
don't have like a me especially to see
this disgrace I heard about it on the
radio
I was simply outraged the construction
appeared 10 days ago in front of a
department store that's also responsible
for the trunk it was to house an
exhibition marking batons a hundred and
twentieth anniversary but that idea
along with a suitcase had been given the
boot state news agency say the Kremlin
has demanded it be removed whilst it
certainly attracted attention it's
probably not quite the publicity
organizers were going for Katarina Moe
BBC News
